item.title: Anti-masker charged with police assault
item.description: An anti-masker who allegedly assaulted a police officer when asked to wear a face covering has been hit with a string of charges including assaulting police, affray and breaching lockdown.

item.title: Dad’s viral solution to lockdown problem
item.description: A push to have Victorians complete their learners permit test online is gaining fierce momentum.

item.title: Pics show bloody aftermath of bikie slaying
item.description: A jury has relived the harrowing underworld killing of former bikie boss Mahmoud “Mick” Hawi and its gruesome aftermath.

item.title: Water polo ref acquitted of raping teen
item.description: A young Sydney water polo referee has been acquitted of raping and indecently assaulting a teenage girl, after arguing in court the sex was consensual.

item.title: Australian share market loses ground
item.description: The Australian share market snapped its two-day winning streak to close lower on the back of a weak US lead and another rise in COVID-19 cases and deaths in Victoria.

item.title: Sivo plans to be the best Fijian flyer
item.description: Parramatta winger Maika Sivo has been copping heat from his teammates all week about his battle against fellow Fijian flyer, Dragons back Mikaele Ravalawa, but he is ready to prove he is the superior player.

item.title: ATO to crack down on early super rorters
item.description: The Australian Taxation Office has warned it will investigate people rorting super withdrawals to avoid paying tax.

item.title: ‘Deeply disturbing’ coronavirus claims
item.description: Aged care providers including some in Victoria have cut staff during the pandemic, the nurses union has claimed at the aged care royal commission.

item.title: Marshals to enforce COVID response
item.description: A number of South Australian businesses, not just licenced-premises, will be required to have a COVID-Safe marshal next week.

item.title: Horror vision of teen being killed by truck
item.description: The truck driver in a horrific crash that claimed the life of a 16-year-old Jason Nguyen emerged from the cabin and asked a witness “Where did he come from?” just after the fatal collision, a court has heard.
